questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'urban'?
questions.explanation: Urban refers to the city; 'rural' refers to the countryside, its opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expand'?
questions.explanation: To expand is to increase in size; 'contract' means to shrink or become smaller.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'admire'?
questions.explanation: Admire means respect or approve; 'despise' means strongly dislike.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'include'?
questions.explanation: Include means to contain or involve; 'omit' means to leave out.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'willing'?
questions.explanation: Willing means ready to do something; 'reluctant' means unwilling or hesitant.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'progress'?
questions.explanation: Progress is forward movement or improvement; 'regress' means to go backward or worsen.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'secure'?
questions.explanation: Secure means safe or protected; 'unsafe' is the direct opposite.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'victory'?
questions.explanation: Victory is winning; 'defeat' is being beaten by an opponent.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expandable'?
questions.explanation: Expandable means able to be enlarged; 'fixed' means not able to change size.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'minimum'?
questions.explanation: Minimum is the smallest amount; 'maximum' is the largest.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'relaxed'?
questions.explanation: Relaxed means calm; 'tense' means tight, anxious, or stressed.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'permanent'?
questions.explanation: Permanent means lasting forever; 'temporary' means lasting for a short time.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'orderly'?
questions.explanation: Orderly means well-organized; 'chaotic' means disorganized and confusing.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'encourage'?
questions.explanation: Encourage means give support or confidence; 'discourage' means to take it away.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expand'?
questions.explanation: To expand is to grow; 'contract' means to shrink back.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'harsh'?
questions.explanation: Harsh means severe or rough; 'gentle' means kind and soft in effect.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'scarce'?
questions.explanation: Scarce means hard to find; 'plentiful' means available in large amounts.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'liberate'?
questions.explanation: Liberate means set free; 'confine' means keep within limits or imprison.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'intricate'?
questions.explanation: Intricate means very detailed or complex; 'simple' means easy or uncomplicated.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'strict'?
questions.explanation: Strict means tough and demanding; 'lenient' means gentle and forgiving.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'superior'?
questions.explanation: Superior means higher in rank or quality; 'inferior' means lower.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'expand'?
questions.explanation: Again, expand vs 'contract' is the standard antonym pair used in exams.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'conceal'?
questions.explanation: Conceal means hide; 'reveal' means show or make known.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'advance'?
questions.explanation: Advance means move forward; 'retreat' means move back.

questions.question: Which word is most nearly OPPOSITE in meaning to 'admit'?
questions.explanation: Admit means acknowledge or accept; 'deny' means refuse to accept as true.
